title: tmux should not set PKG_CONFIG_PATH
body:
tmux should not set "PKG_CONFIG_PATH=..." in the call to configure() in package.py.

This overwrites the environment's PKG_CONFIG_PATH, which causes problems with the Cray compiler wrappers (cc, CC, and ftn).  The Cray compiler wrappers use pkg-config to find packages according to the modules loaded in the environment.  But it can't find these packages if the PKG_CONFIG_PATH is improperly set.

For example, after running `spack install -v tmux`, I was seeing errors like this:

```
configure:3021: checking for gcc
configure:3048: result: /p/home/sbateman/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/gcc
configure:3277: checking for C compiler version
configure:3286: /p/home/sbateman/spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/gcc --version >&5
pkg-config error:
Package AtpSigHandler was not found in the pkg-config search path.
Perhaps you should add the directory containing `AtpSigHandler.pc'
to the PKG_CONFIG_PATH environment variable
No package 'AtpSigHandler' found
configure:3297: $? = 1
```

This pull request fixes the problem by removing the "PKG_CONFIG_PATH=..." argument from the call to configure().  `spack install -v tmux` seems to correctly find the libevent and ncurses libraries anyway.
